titles.title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 35 Park Street in Danville, Vermont, as the "Thaddeus Stevens Post Office".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Carper without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 159.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Mr. Issa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 885.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 11/26/2014--Public Law. Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 35 Park Street in Danville, Vermont, as the "Thaddeus Stevens Post Office."
